alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 6:09PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, Orleans and north central Jefferson Parishes through 715 PM CDT... At 607 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over Lake Pontchartrain near Metairie, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tropical Funnels and winds in excess of 30 to 40mph. Waterspout possible near shore of Lake Pontchartrain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, East New Orleans, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Lake Catherine, Arabi, Meraux, Bridge City and Lakefront Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 228 and 254. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Jefferson; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
